typeSystemDescription.name: JCoRe File Multiplier Types
typeSystemDescription.description: This is a type system for usage with a CAS multiplier. It should not be included into the jcore-all-types type system. This particular type system holds a array containing strings that represent the IDs of documents to read from database tables. Using an array is used to read batches of document which make database access more efficient, for example. Since the primary keys of database tables may have multiple elements, a document ID is represented as a StringArray. Multiple tables may be specified in which case the tables should be joined on the given document primary keys. This mechanism may be used to read a base document and annotations that have been previously created and stored in separate tables. This is part of the Jena Document Information System, JeDIS.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.casmultiplier.RowBatch
typeDescription.description: A batch of rows of a database table. An array of identifier strings denotes a documents. The name of the table to retrieve the IDs from is another feature of this type. The CAS multiplier receiving instances of this type must have access to the correct database.

featureDescription.name: identifiers
featureDescription.description: The document IDs to be read by the CAS multiplier.

featureDescription.name: tableName
featureDescription.description: The name of the table that was specified in the reader's descriptor.

featureDescription.name: tables
featureDescription.description: The tables to read the given IDs from. The first element is always the primary data table. If there is more than one array entry, the additional tables are joined by primary key to the first table. The additional tables might hold annotations segmented away from the base document, for example.

featureDescription.name: tableSchemas
featureDescription.description: The CoStoSys table schemas of the tables to read.

featureDescription.name: costosysConfiguration
featureDescription.description: The CoStoSys configuration file path or classpath location.

featureDescription.name: readsBaseXmiDocument
featureDescription.description: Only for XMI DB readers. Specifies whether the JeDIS annotation module base XMI document is read (feature set to true) or a complete, unmodularized XMI document (set to false).

featureDescription.name: xmiAnnotationModuleNames
featureDescription.description: Only for XMI DB readers. Lists the Java names of the annotation types whose annotations should be read.

featureDescription.name: storeMaxXmiId
featureDescription.description: Only for XMI DB readers. Specifies whether the documents' max XMI ID should be stored in the multiplier CAS. Necessary for the use with the jcore-xmi-db-consumer.

featureDescription.name: increasedAttributeSize
featureDescription.description: For the XMI splitter. Specifies the maximum attribute size the XML parser accepts. Necessary for large texts.

featureDescription.name: xercesAttributeBufferSize
featureDescription.description: For the XMI splitter. Allows to increase the internal buffer of the Xerces parser used for attribute values.
